programme.title: Space Channel News Update | Deep Space Technologies
programme.desc: Back in 2006, to minimize competition, Boeing and North Grumman decided to form a joint venture for a period of time, realizing that they would no longer be bidding against each other for giant NASA contracts. This plan worked swimmingly until newcomers SpaceX arrived on the scene, and there was competition again. Duration: 1800

programme.title: Social Space
programme.desc: Tom Brady hates our Moon...but Mars is a completely different story. From cosmic cosmology to Musk See TV, we scroll through our galactic web of fascinating featurettes from everyone we follow. Oh and Astronomy VS Astrology! Duration: 1800

programme.title: Latest News - China Starlink update
programme.desc: As commercial and government space programs continue to overlap, China seems particularly worried about SpaceX. According to China Military Online, an official website linked to China’s Central Military Commission, Elon Musk’s SpaceX might be used by the “hegemony-obsessed US” to dominate space and bring “chaos or calamity” to the world. Duration: 190

programme.title: Edge of Infinity - ISLANDS
programme.desc:
In a sense, each of us is an island. In another sense, however, we are all one. For though islands appear separate, and may even be situated at great distances from one another, they are only extrusions of the same planet, Earth.
- J. Donald Walters Duration: 234

programme.title: David Becker - Truth Lies Within
programme.desc: Jazz Guitarist David Becker captures the ultimate Universal duality that's hard to ignore. In Partnership with Space Channel Music, David's melodious guitar takes us on a journey through space and time to discover the truth in all things, and our connection and rhythm with the Cosmos Duration: 500

programme.title: New Mars
programme.desc: A new generation lives underground on Mars preparing to begin a new life as the colonists of a planet which is being terraformed into a new habitable world. Duration: 1333

programme.title: Latest News - Red Moon Rising
programme.desc: In 2021, it achieved an average of more than one launch per week for the first time in its orbital spaceflight history, making it the busiest year for its space program to date. We watched the country pass many milestones from successfully landing its first rover on Mars and test flying a hypersonic spaceplane to building the core module for its Tiangong space station and launching the first taikonauts onto the said module. Duration: 300

programme.title: David Becker - Around the Universe
programme.desc: For more than three decades, Grammy and Emmy nominated guitarist, composer, producer David Becker has continued to define himself as one of the best and most unique voices in jazz and contemporary music by combining diverse influences and a passion for the new and different, and his ability to play for the present while always keeping an eye on the past and future. He has led the critically acclaimed DAVID BECKER TRIBUNE to a worldwide audience by performing in more than 35 countries. Duration: 262

programme.title: Brownsville: Gateway to the stars
programme.desc: Elon Tweeted a 10 second video of the booster 7 static fire - which used 7 raptor engines marking the biggest test of its kind. After the test, which appeared to be a success, Elon tweeted: “BOOSTER 7 now returns to high bay for robustness upgrades & booster 8 moves to pad for testing. Next big test is probably full stack wet dress rehearsal, then 33 engine firing in a few weeks. “ Duration: 218

programme.title: Cradle
programme.desc: Eade and her dad are on the return journey to earth when an explosion cripples the craft and seriously injures her father. Duration: 920

programme.title: Near Death Spacewalk Experience
programme.desc: On July 16, 2013, the Italian Luca Parmitano nearly drowned in his own helmet during an outing outside the space station. In this dark, silent environment, this astronaut has seen his entire life pass by before his eyes for a moment. According to him, he came close to death. After a few minutes of work, the Italian felt something strange at the level of his neck. Water entered his wetsuit, but he didn't know where it came from. He informed his colleague and Houston of this small problem and was ordered to return to the decompression chamber. Unfortunately on the way back, the volume of the liquid increased. The top of his helmet was flooded. His earphones were wet, which could have deprived him of any contact with others. Her vision, too, was altered and the risk of drowning was imminent. Luckily, he managed to keep his mouth out of the water, which saved him. Duration: 721

programme.title: Gravitation: Variation in Time and Space
programme.desc: Gravitation is a synergy of dance and cinema. It features Diana Vishneva, principal dancer of the Mariinsky Ballet and the American Ballet Theater. The film is the story of creation, inner struggle and transformation. Calligraphic black and white images are rich in metaphors exploring the notions of time and space, movement and light. Duration: 946

programme.title: Commercial Space Stations update
programme.desc: With exciting new prospects such as Orbital Reef, Starlab, and Gravitics Starmax, commercialized Space travel is no longer Science Fiction. Duration: 275

programme.title: Helix Collective - Helix Collective Amber Moon
programme.desc: Variety Magazine‘s Jon Burlingame praised Helix Collective’s musical range including an “edgy chamber-music sound” to “sweetly romantic” to evoking “wide-open-spaces.” Duration: 145

programme.title: Helix Collective - Helix Collective's Virgins Pass
programme.desc: Helix Collective is a Los Angeles-based ensemble that specializes in multi-media, collaborative performance and recording. Helix has released four critically acclaimed albums and has recorded the scores for over fifty films. The ensemble is at home in nightclubs and on the concert stage. Helix “has a little something for everyone: those who like their classics straight up, with a contemporary edge to it, or with populist appeal.” Called “dizzyingly virtuosic with exquisite musicianship and world-class range” by The Free Times and praised for their “beyond-the-ordinary programming,” the flexible instrumentation ensemble performs as a trio, quartet, a small chamber orchestra, and everything in between. Duration: 218

programme.title: Phobos Bounce
programme.desc: Phobos is one of two very small satellites of the planet Mars. ... The moons are named after the children of the Greek god Ares - who, like the Roman Mars, is the god of war. Deimos means 'terror' or 'panic' and Phobos means 'fear'. Phobos has an equatorial orbit, which is almost circular. Duration: 352
